=== Current Issues ===
==== Gutsy ====
* Tribe5: regression - suspend to RAM is broken - <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/bugs/136258|#136258]]</nowiki> - '''Status''': no workaround
* Tribe5: regression - restart of system is broken <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/bugs/136257|#136257]]</nowiki> - '''Status:''': workaround: shutdown the system and power-on

==== Gutsy & Feisty & Edgy ====
* Edgy Knot1-Gutsy Tribe5: battery info does not change after hibernation/resume - <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/bugs/63123|#63123]]</nowiki> - '''Status:''' no workaround yet (see note *13)

==== Gutsy & Feisty & Edgy & Dapper ====
* Dapper-Gutsy Tribe5: wrong screen resolution after lid open - <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/bugs/40808|40808]]</nowiki> - '''Status''': workaround (see note *8)

=== Issues with Older Releases (closed in current release) ===
* Feisty Beta-Release: regression - blanks screen with live CD after xorg 7.2 update <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/bugs/90571|#90571]]</nowiki> - '''Status''': workaround (see note *14)
* Edgy RC-Feisty: wrong screen resolution (1024x768) with Desktop CD - <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/bugs/61390|#61390]]</nowiki> - '''Status''': workaround (see note *12)
* Dapper Flight3-Release: blank screen after installation (was OK in Flight2) - <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/bugs/22985|#22985]]</nowiki> - '''Status''': workaround (see note *6)
* Dapper Flight4-Release: suspend to RAM almost works with "ati" driver - <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/bugs/33827|#33827]]</nowiki>  - '''Status:''' workaround (see note *9)
* Dapper Flight4-Release: system hangs on restart of X server with fglrx - <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/bugs/30447|#30447]]</nowiki> - '''Status''': workaround (see note *10)
* Breezy-Dapper: Special key assignment for volume controls - <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/bugs/46948|#46948]]</nowiki> - '''Status''': workaround (see note *2)
* Breezy-Dapper: Special key assignment for Info, Presentation, Sleep, Battery keys - <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/bugs/20317|#20317]]</nowiki> - '''Status''': workaround (see note *2)
* Breezy-Dapper: KsCD does not play CDs out of the box - <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/bugs/30809|#30809]]</nowiki> - '''Status:''' workaround (see note *3)

=== Closed issues ===
* Herd1: regression - suspend to RAM is broken - <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/bugs/74877|#74877]]</nowiki> - '''Status''': fixed with 2.6.20-15 kernel
* Knot2: white stripes when booting Desktop CD - <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/bugs/58455|#58455]]</nowiki> - '''Status''':  fixed with usplash in Edgy RC
* Knot1/2: blank screen after Desktop CD boot/install - <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/bugs/22985|#22985]]</nowiki> - '''Status''': fixed with new xorg ati driver in Edgy RC
* Flight 4 & Beta: suspend to RAM does nothing from klaptop - <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/bugs/32785|#32785]]</nowiki> - '''Status''': fixed in acpi-support
* Flight 5/6: major regression - installation hangs on splash screen - <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/bugs/34586|#34586]]</nowiki> - '''Status''': general issue with ATI x700/x800 cards - FIXED with daily CD 2006-04-08 and confirmed with Beta
* Flight 5: hibernate broken with recent kernels - <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/bugs/34587|#34587]]</nowiki> - '''Status''': FIXED with kernel 2.6.15-20
* Flight 4/6: install from gxfboot results in kernel panic - <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/bugs/31974|#31974]]</nowiki> - '''Status''': workaround - press Esc and  boot from text mode - cannot reproduce with Beta
* Breezy: Default font size is too huge on 147 DPI - <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/bugs/25656|#25656]]</nowiki> - '''Status''': fixed with Dapper (see note *1)
* Breezy: Hibernation/Suspend does not work by default - '''Status''': hibernate works with fglrx drivers from ATI (see note *4)

 1. ''CLOSED: KsCD: does not play audio CDs - FIXED in Edgy RC''

 1. '''fglrx drivers from ATI''': make 3D acceleration support
     I have used the instructions listed under <nowiki>[[BinaryDriverHowto-ATI]]</nowiki>. <<BR>>
     '''Breezy''': fixes hibernation (which does not work with "ati" driver) <<BR>>
     '''Dapper''': fixes suspend to RAM (which does not work without workaround with "ati" driver) <<BR>>
     '''Edgy''': fixes lid close screen corruption

 1. ''CLOSED: Dapper Flight2: eth0 down after boot - FIXED in Flight3''

 1. ''CLOSED: Dapper Flight3-Release; Edgy Knot1/2: monitor layout not auto detected (blank screen after install) - FIXED in Edgy RC''

 1. ''CLOSED: Dapper Flight4: ipw2200 module need hwcrypto=0 to work - FIXED in Flight6''

 1. '''Dapper Beta-Release/Edgy RC: after opening lid, display is in wrong resolution ("ati" driver)''' - <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/bugs/40808|40808]]</nowiki>
    When closing lid, display is blank as it should, but after reopening I just get completely strange resolution as I can only see what is the mouse arrow (which is approximately 3 times the original size and stretched). This is only with "ati" driver, while "fglrx" driver does not have this problem. <<BR>>
    '''Workaround:''' you can get back to normal by switching consoles (Ctrl-Alt-F1, Ctrl-Alt-F7).

 1. ''CLOSED: Dapper Beta-Release: suspend to RAM works, but resume needs help ("ati" driver) -  FIXED in Edgy RC''

 1. '''Dapper Flight4-Release: system hangs on restart of X server with fglrx''' - <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/bugs/30447|#30447]]</nowiki>
    When X server is restarted it may hang the system. This only happens with "fglrx" driver, while "ati" works as expected. <<BR>>
    '''Workaround:''' add (uncomment) the line <code>TerminateServer=true</code> in section <code>[X-:*-Core]</code> in <code>/etc/kde3/kdm/kdmrc</code> file

 1. ''CLOSED: Edgy Knot2: Desktop CD boots into white stripes - FIXED in Edgy RC''

 1. ''CLOSED: Edgy RC: wrong resolution detected by Desktop CD - Fixed in Gutsy Tribe5''

 1. '''Edgy Knot1-RC: battery info does not change after hibernate/resume''' - <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/bugs/63123|#63123]]</nowiki>
   Hibernate works, but after resume battery information does not get updated anymore. Info is not updated already on kernel level (<code>/proc/acpi/battery/*/*</code>).
   Sometimes it helps if AC adapter is unplugged and plugged.

 1. ''CLOSED: Feisty Beta-Release: regression - blanks screen with live CD after xorg 7.2 update - FIXED in Gutsy Tribe5''
